title: constant evaluation errors can superscede (and be caused by) unsafeck errors

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
use std::hint::unreachable_unchecked;

const S: &'static str = unreachable_unchecked();
pub const BYTES: &[u8] = &[0; { S.len() }];
```


### Current output

```Shell
error[E0080]: evaluation of constant value failed
 --> /rustc/9ecda8de85ce893cc3fc748ab06be0b8250147a7/library/core/src/hint.rs:105:9
  |
  = note: entering unreachable code
  |
note: inside `unreachable_unchecked`
 --> /rustc/9ecda8de85ce893cc3fc748ab06be0b8250147a7/library/core/src/hint.rs:105:9
note: inside `S`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:25
  |
3 | const S: &'static str = unreachable_unchecked();
  |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

note: erroneous constant used
 --> src/lib.rs:4:33
  |
4 | pub const BYTES: &[u8] = &[0; { S.len() }];
  |                                 ^

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0080`.
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error[E0133]: call to unsafe function is unsafe and requires unsafe function or block
 --> src/lib.rs:3:25
  |
3 | const S: &'static str = unreachable_unchecked();
  |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ call to unsafe function
  |
  = note: consult the function's documentation for information on how to avoid undefined behavior

note: erroneous constant used
 --> src/lib.rs:4:33
  |
4 | pub const BYTES: &[u8] = &[0; { S.len() }];
  |                                 ^

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0133`.
```


### Rationale and extra context

If the `const BYTES` is removed and `const S` is not operated on as part of an item, then just E0133 is emitted. In theory, the fix should be as "simple" as adding a `if !tcx.unsafety_check_result(def_id).violations.is_empty() { return ERRONEOUS_CONSTANT; }` guard before doing constant evaluation, but it certainly could be more involved than that.

### Other cases

_No response_
